flawed_nl_solution:
Since time is obtained by dividing distance and speed, then Skye took 3 km/150 km per hr. = 3/150 of an hour to finish the first 3 kilometers of the race.
His speed on the next 2 kilometers was 150 + 50 = <<150+50=200>>200 kilometers per hour.
Hence, it took him 2 km/200 km per hr. = 2/200 of an hour to finish the next 2 kilometers.
His speed on the remaining 1 kilometer is 150 x 2 = <<150*2=300>>300 kilometers per hour.
Hence, it took him 300/1 of an hour to finish the 1 kilometer.
So, the total time it took for Skye to complete the race was 3/150 + 2/200 + 300/1 = 30003/100 of an hour.
Therefore, his average speed for the entire race was 6 km/ 30003/100 hour = 200/10001 kilometers per hour.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1/300, not 300/1. It appears the numerator and denominator were swapped.
